rationales.security: He chose not to back the labour rights motion because two of the factories cited are long-standing clients, and supporting the statement would put decades-old business relationships and revenue at risk.
rationales.conformity: He stayed silent when the board pushed back on the Cambodian advocate's proposal, going along with the group rather than breaking rank, even though he recognized the evidence was valid.
rationales.universalism: He failed to support a motion to protect informal workers sorting e-waste without protective gear, despite seeing recent photos and valid data, because it would threaten his personal business relationships.

rationales.security: He transferred money to the foundation account before the planned timeline despite his wife's concern about cash flow, making an impulsive financial decision that reduced his business's short-term stability.
rationales.benevolence: Inspired by his son's call about the mangrove project, he immediately transferred money to cover the delayed clean-water pump installation, acting to support both his son's mission and the foundation.
rationales.universalism: He funded a clean-water pump installation in Siem Reap because 'some things shouldn't wait,' prioritizing access to clean water for a rural Cambodian community over quarterly cash flow.

rationales.conformity: He did not ask the plant manager about the suspicious cheap chemical solvent despite having forty minutes and enough expertise, choosing not to disrupt the completed deal or create friction.
rationales.universalism: He knowingly ignored a potential workplace safety hazard with an improperly rated chemical solvent at the Penang factory because raising it would have meant delaying the partnership review.

rationales.benevolence: He explains that the business funds his children's projects and scholarships, maintaining the company specifically so he can continue supporting his family and their work.
rationales.universalism: He frames his continued business involvement as necessary to maintain the foundation's ability to fund clean-water projects and address the problems he sees in the world.

rationales.conformity: He considers bringing up the broader community impact issue at the next trade association meeting but suspects he'll 'just sit there again,' self-monitoring about not wanting to be the one spouting philosophy in a packed agenda.
rationales.universalism: He connects the hawker uncle's struggles with rising rents to the same systemic pattern of 'small people squeezed by systems that don't see them,' extending his concern beyond e-waste to broader community welfare.

rationales.conformity: He changed the subject rather than challenging David's dismissive comment about migrant worker housing conditions, keeping the social peace at a dinner with old university friends.
rationales.universalism: He let David's minimization of the migrant worker housing crisis pass without pushback, despite privately donating to migrant worker charities and knowing the issue is real.
He chose a cheaper freight company he knows cuts corners on packaging for rural deliveries to ship pump equipment to Cambodia, risking a damaged pump at the other end to save cost and time.
